page.title: 12BLAIRS COLLEGE TODAY
page.content: Blairs is a seminary where boys from twelve to eighteen come to find out if they would like to become{priests. Apart from time spent together each day in prayer, the boys are taught ordinary subjects for their O-Grades and Highers by thirteen priests and six lay teachers. The boys engage in different sports and hobbies on the{1500 acre estate - football, tennis etc. There are recreational rooms and a theatre too where the parents are entertained to a Gilbert & Sullivan opera since music plays such a large part in college life. Gardening and work on the farm also take up some of the boy's time. Although all the boys are boarders they do get home at holiday time.
